data.title: Barnstable Vacation Rentals Cape Cod, MA
data.meta_description: Discover the best Barnstable Vacation Rentals with Del Mar. Experience Cape Cod's hidden gem with our pristine properties, 5-star service, and unmatched locations.
data.text:
Historical Charm and Cultural Attractions

Barnstable is steeped in history and boasts several historical sites and cultural attractions that provide a glimpse into the region's past. Explore the village of Barnstable, known for its charming Main Street lined with historic homes, boutiques, art galleries, and restaurants. Visit the Coast Guard Heritage Museum to learn about the area's maritime history and view exhibits showcasing the U.S. Coast Guard's legacy.

Don't miss a visit to the Barnstable Historical Society's Custom House, a beautifully preserved 19th-century building that offers guided tours and exhibits highlighting the town's seafaring heritage. Discover the Sturgis Library, one of the oldest libraries in the United States, with a collection that dates back to the 17th century.

Natural Beauty and Outdoor Recreation

Barnstable is blessed with breathtaking natural beauty and abundant outdoor recreation opportunities. Enjoy the pristine beaches that dot the coastline, such as Sandy Neck Beach and Craigville Beach, where you can soak up the sun, swim in the Atlantic Ocean, or take leisurely walks along the shore. Explore the extensive trail system at the Barnstable Conservation Area, offering scenic hikes through woodlands, marshes, and along freshwater ponds.

For nature enthusiasts, a visit to the Cape Cod Natural History Museum is a must. Discover the region's diverse ecosystems, learn about local wildlife, and explore interactive exhibits. Take a scenic boat tour or go fishing in Barnstable Harbor, known for its picturesque views and bountiful marine life. Whether you're a beach lover, hiker, or wildlife enthusiast, Barnstable's natural wonders will leave you in awe.

Quaint Villages and Family-Friendly Fun

Barnstable encompasses several charming villages, each with its own unique character and attractions. Visit the village of Hyannis, the largest in Barnstable, known for its bustling Main Street, vibrant waterfront district, and the John F. Kennedy Hyannis Museum, which showcases the life and legacy of the former U.S. President.

In the village of Cotuit, explore the Cahoon Museum of American Art, featuring an impressive collection of American art and hosting various exhibitions and events throughout the year. Take the family to the Cape Cod Children's Museum in Mashpee, where kids can engage in hands-on activities and interactive exhibits.

Comfortable and Convenient Accommodations

One of the highlights of booking a Barnstable vacation rental is the comfortable and convenient accommodations that await you. Whether you prefer a cozy cottage or a spacious waterfront home, Barnstable vacation rentals offer a range of options to suit your needs and preferences.

Enjoy the privacy and freedom of having your own space, complete with fully equipped kitchens, comfortable living areas, and outdoor spaces to relax and soak up the Cape Cod atmosphere. Many vacation rentals also offer amenities such as high-speed internet, cable TV, and laundry facilities, ensuring a comfortable and convenient stay.

Enjoy The Best Summer and Beach Vacation Rentals & Cottages

Barnstable, MA vacation rentals are a superb option for visitors to Cape Cod’s largest town and official hub.

Indeed, with over 100 miles of beaches, many explorers look to Del Mar’s catalog of Barnstable rentals, including popular Craigville Beach vacation rentals and Sandy Neck beach rentals. Scenic Craigville beach cottages vie with the calm of Sandy Neck beach vacation rentals, while Englewood Beach hideaways offer the ultimate in seashell hunting excursions.

There is a wealth of other things to do in Barnstable MA, and Barnstable cottages are a natural option for visitors looking to explore Hyannis vacation rentals and the many museum and tour experiences paying tribute to the JFK legacy. Other Barnstable vacation rentals include options near Barnstable Village, from which you can embark on extraordinary sightseeing cruises.

Book Your Barnstable Vacation Today

Barnstable Harbor

Explore Barnstable Harbor, a picturesque waterfront area offering scenic views, boating opportunities, and a chance to observe marine life.

Sandy Neck Beach Park

Visit Sandy Neck Beach Park, a beautiful stretch of coastline with sandy dunes, hiking trails, and opportunities for swimming, fishing, and wildlife spotting.

Cape Cod Maritime Museum

Discover the rich maritime heritage of Cape Cod at the Cape Cod Maritime Museum. Explore exhibits, artifacts, and interactive displays showcasing the region's seafaring history.

Hyannis Harbor

Explore Hyannis Harbor, a bustling waterfront area with marinas, shops, restaurants, and the Cape Cod Maritime Museum. Take a scenic harbor cruise or stroll along the waterfront.

Barnstable Village

Explore the charming Barnstable Village, home to historic buildings, shops, art galleries, and restaurants. Visit the Sturgis Library, one of the oldest libraries in the United States.
